text: it's well known that Boris Johnson
wavered over which side to support in
the referendum just days before
declaring he backed brexit mr. Johnson
wrote a series of articles not all
intended for publication setting out the
conflicting arguments now The Sunday
Times has printed the column in which he
made the case for remain in it mr.
Johnson said the UK should be intimately
engaged with the EU he suggested brexit
could lead to an economic shock or the
breakup of the UK and said access to the
single market came with just a small
membership fee directly contradicting
his public stars both during the
referendum campaign and since becoming
Foreign Secretary sources said mr.
Johnson only wrote the piece to help
articulate his thoughts and it made him
realize the case for staying in the EU
was weak and while critics will say the
existence of this column undermines mr.
Johnson's commitment to brexit the full
content appears only to highlight his
long he'll to your sceptic views Alex
Forsythe BBC News Westminster
